intro: Catamixis baccharoides, commonly known as the golden sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, branching stems and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant has adapted to harsh environments with its ability to store water in its fleshy leaves and stems. Its flowers are typically unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same inflorescence. Catamixis baccharoides is often found in sandy or gravelly soils, thriving in full sun and low moisture conditions.
